Source code for havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.nvme.nvme_factory

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.nvme.vendor.samsung import Samsung
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.nvme.vendor.toshiba import Toshiba
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.nvme.vendor.liteon import LiteOn
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.nvme.nvme_utils import NVMeUtils
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.nvme.nvme_drive import NVMeDrive

VENDORS = [Samsung, LiteOn, Toshiba]



[docs]class NVMeDriveFactory:


[docs]    def __init__(self, host):
        self.nvme_util = NVMeUtils(host)



[docs]    def create(self, host, drive, config):
        """
        @param Host host:
        @param String drive: e.g. nvme1n1
        @param String config: config file name
        """
        vid = self.nvme_util.get_vendor_id(drive)

        try:
            vendor_cls = [_cls for _cls in VENDORS if _cls.VID == vid].pop()
            drive = vendor_cls(host, drive, config)
        except IndexError:
            drive = NVMeDrive(host, drive, config)

        return drive
